content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 4 column table with 2 rows of data. The heading for column 1 is “t.” The heading for column 2 is “W.” The heading for column 3 is “the derivative of W, with respect to t.” The heading for column 4 is “the second derivative of W, with respect to t.” The data in the table are as follows. Row 1. t is 0. W is 10. the derivative of W, with respect to t, is 6. the second derivative of W, with respect to t, is 3. Row 2. t is 2.56. W is 35. the derivative of W, with respect to t, is 12.25. the second derivative of W, with respect to t, is 0. " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.5ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mi>W</mi></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2.56</mn></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>35</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12.25</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The weight, in grams, of a population of bacteria at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> hours is modeled by the function <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the solution to a logistic differential equation. Selected values of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its first and second derivatives are shown in the table above. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 3 over 125, end fraction, times W times, open parenthesis, 35 minus W, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the carrying capacity is 35 and the rate of change of the weight is 6 grams per hour when the weight is 10 grams.

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 3 over 250, end fraction, times W times, open parenthesis, 35 minus W, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the carrying capacity is 35 and the rate of change of the weight is 3 grams per hour when the weight is 10 grams.

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 100, end fraction, times W times, open parenthesis, 70 minus W, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the carrying capacity is 70 and the rate of change of the weight is 6 grams per hour when the weight is 10 grams.

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 200, end fraction, times W times, open parenthesis, 70 minus W, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the carrying capacity is 70 and the rate of change of the weight is 3 grams per hour when the weight is 10 grams.

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 100, end fraction, times W times, open parenthesis, 70 minus W, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>W</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the carrying capacity is 70 and the rate of change of the weight is 6 grams per hour when the weight is 10 grams.

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
